title: When the Garden Crumbled to the Kingdom
description:
When the garden crumbled to the kingdom

Every moment Devine 
from the formation to decay
From clay to callous 
And mercy to malevolence
The age of decay to the birth of a beach
Even the mustard seed that never sprouts
Becomes soil for the deprived or the spoiled to rejoice or to pout 

Love made into life
Life turned to strife
Blood into blood
Or blood boiled turned spilled by sacrifice or by knife

Even the mountains crumble and the clouds come and go
And the sun Spins away
Night into day day day before dawn the same as dawn before day

The age of decay and decay comes of age.
